product_name: Beekman 1802Magnesium Milk Barrier Reset Jelly Mist
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackBeekman 1802 Magnesium Milk Barrier Reset Jelly Mist instantly calms skin redness, irritation, and stress—without disrupting the microbiome.
details: DetailsBenefitsVisibly reduces the appearance of redness and irritation in just 30 minutesTargets the root cause of skin stress: cortisol spikesFuture-proofs the skin barrier against inflammationYour skin’s first responder for flushing, stress rashes, and dry, irritated skinUnique aloe-based jelly-to-mist formula deeply soothes the skinFragrance-free, no harsh chlorine smellSafe for sensitive skinKey IngredientsMagnesium + Complex: Targets the root cause of skin stress—cortisol spikes—to help Calm, Protect, and Reset red, irritated skin. It's like CPR for your skin.Goat Milk: Packed with 31 active nutrients that protect and strengthen the skin barrierHeartleaf: Packed with skin-soothing nutrients that help reset the skin barrierFormulated without hypochlorous acid, fragrance, parabens, sulfates, mineral oil, and alcoholResearch ResultsUp to 65% decrease in redness after 30 minutes*90% said skin felt calmer**Based on a study of 20 women with sensitive skin using Magnesium + Complex at 2% twice a day for 28 daysItem 2641674How To UseSpray 8 inches away onto clean, dry skin and let it absorb. Use twice daily after cleansing---or any time skin feels red, irritated, or in need of a reset.Avoid the eyes.IngredientsWater (Aqua), 1,2-Hexanediol, Glycerin, Gellan Gum, Ethylhexylglycerin, Magnesium PCA, Bisabolol, Propanediol, Calcium Chloride, Melia Azadirachta Leaf Extract, Solanum Lycopersicum (Tomato) Fruit Extract, Houttuynia Cordata (Heartleaf) Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Salix Alba (Willow) Bark Extract, Melia Azadirachta Flower Extract, Maltodextrin, Caprae Lac (Goat Milk), Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Tephrosia Purpurea Seed Extract, Hydroxymethoxyphenyl Decanone, Silica, Sorbitan Trioleate, Apium Graveolens (Celery) Seed Extract, Linum Usitatissimum (Linseed) Seed Extract ... and Kindness.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Spray 8 inches away onto clean, dry skin and let it absorb. Use twice daily after cleansing---or any time skin feels red, irritated, or in need of a reset.Avoid the eyes.
ingredients: Linum Usitatissimum (Linseed) Seed Extract ... and Kindness

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and plan on it
reviews.comments: I love this product so far. It makes my bright red cheeks an even tone and quickly.

reviews.headline: Sprayer is meh
reviews.comments: The sprayer is kinda crappy. Feels like a straight line shooting onto your face but I do like the formula. The "mist" is cooling and feels really nice.

reviews.headline: Noooooo :(
reviews.comments: I wanted to like this product so badly! I was thinking this was going to help my skin so much. I thought I just got a defective product. It sprays out so harshly. I ended up flinching so hard that I reinjured my healing neck. After I tried the product, realized something gross floating in it too. Returned/exchanged for a new one. The 2nd also had a super harsh mist and flinched so hard again! It's nothing like their other spray products. So sad this doesn't have a fine and gentle mist like people claim. Going with a different brand for a spray that calms reddness.

reviews.headline: Skin Irritation
reviews.comments: Saw this new item at Ulta. I absolutely love Beekman products so used the sample to try on both forearms while shopping around. It didnt do anything for the redness so i didnt purchase. However, within 45-60 minutes after spraying ny forearms broke out with horribly itchy welts. Its now 36 hrs later and I still have them. So definitely not the product for me.

reviews.headline: It calmed my red (flushed) upper body!
reviews.comments: I know this is supposed to be for the face but I use it to calm the redness on my arms and chest. I use a couple sprays on each arm and rub it in so it spreads out well. It's not sticky and had no strong scent. The rep says that she thinks they will come put with a body edition and/or bigger bottle once the word gets out.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I've been using the Magnesium Milk Mist for a few weeks now, and it's genuinely impressed me. My skin tends to react easily—whether from stress, heat, or product overload—so I'm always looking for something that calms irritation without adding to the problem. This mist does exactly that.

Right after applying it, my skin feels cooler and noticeably less inflamed. The redness, especially around my nose and cheeks, fades down within half an hour, just like the brand claims. It has a jelly-to-mist texture that feels refreshing and light, and I love that it doesn't leave any stickiness or residue. It also layers really well with the rest of my routine, so I can use it morning and night without worrying about pilling or greasiness.

What really makes this stand out is the ingredient profile. The magnesium complex seems to help my skin stay calmer throughout the day, not just in the moment. I've also noticed that I've had fewer stress-related flare-ups while using it. The fact that it's free of fragrance, alcohol, and other common irritants is a big plus for anyone with sensitive skin like mine.

That said, it's not a miracle product—it won't fix everything on its own. If you're looking for deep hydration or treatment for acne, this won't do that. It's more of a support product, like a calming reset button for irritated skin. Also, depending on the price, it might feel a little expensive for what it is, and I do wish the mist itself came out in a finer spray.

Overall, I really like it. It does what it promises, feels great on the skin, and genuinely helps when my face is feeling stressed, flushed, or reactive. I'd definitely keep using it, especially during stressful weeks or in extreme weather when my skin needs a little extra help staying calm.
faceoff_positive.headline: Great mist

faceoff_negative.comments:
Beekman 1802 kindly sent me their Magnesium Milk Barrier Reset Jelly Mist to try in exchange for my honest thoughts.

I appreciated the clean ingredients, especially while pregnant, and I really wanted to like this product more. Unfortunately, it just didn't work for me.

I didn't notice any reduction in redness after consistent use. I even had my husband try it, since he has very noticeable red, patchy skin. He said it made his skin tingle and burn, and he had to wash it off right away. After a week of using it myself including while recovering from an international flight when my skin was especially dry — I also experienced some tingling and slight burning.

The packaging looks nice, but the spray pump is very aggressive. It misted everywhere hair, shoulders, even clothes so I had to spray it into my hands and pat it onto my face instead. A gentler air pump might suit the jelly-like texture better.

On the positive side, the product dries quickly and has only the faintest fruity scent. But since I didn't see any benefits and it caused irritation, I wouldn't recommend it.
faceoff_negative.headline: Didn't Work for Me, Irritation and No Results
